ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject

Class UltrasonicLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.UltrasonicLocalizer

  • public class UltrasonicLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements falling or rising edge localization to help direct the robot towards true 0 degrees
    Author:
    Mai Zeng

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int chooseWhichRoutine 
      private static int DISTANCE 
      private Navigation navigation 
      private static int NOISE 
      private Odometer odo 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UltrasonicLocalizer(Navigation navigation, int chooseWhichRoutine) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void fallingEdgeRoutine()
      If the robot starts facing away from the walls, it can: Detect a falling edge, continue in the same direction, then detect a rising edge
      private void risingEdgeRoutine()
      If the robot starts facing a wall, it can: Detect a rising edge, switch directions, then detect another rising edge Detect a rising edge, continue in the same direction, then detect a falling edge
      void whichRoutine()
      This method is to process the input that the user just gave, whether using a routine of falling edge or a routine of rising edge if the chooseWhichRoutine == 0 then use the rising edge routine else use a falling edge routine

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UltrasonicLocalizer

        public UltrasonicLocalizer(Navigation navigation,
                   int chooseWhichRoutine)
                    throws OdometerExceptions
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

    • Method Detail

      • whichRoutine

        public void whichRoutine()
        This method is to process the input that the user just gave, whether using a routine of falling edge or a routine of rising edge if the chooseWhichRoutine == 0 then use the rising edge routine else use a falling edge routine

      • risingEdgeRoutine

        private void risingEdgeRoutine()
        If the robot starts facing a wall, it can: Detect a rising edge, switch directions, then detect another rising edge Detect a rising edge, continue in the same direction, then detect a falling edge

      • fallingEdgeRoutine

        private void fallingEdgeRoutine()
        If the robot starts facing away from the walls, it can: Detect a falling edge, continue in the same direction, then detect a rising edge
